remixlab.remixcam.core
Class InteractiveFrame

java.lang.Object
  remixlab.remixcam.core.GLFrame
      remixlab.remixcam.core.InteractiveFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, MouseGrabbable
Direct Known Subclasses:
InteractiveDrivableFrame
public class InteractiveFrame
extends GLFrame
implements MouseGrabbable, java.lang.Cloneable

A InteractiveFrame is a Frame that can be rotated and translated using the mouse.

It converts the mouse motion into a translation and an orientation updates. A InteractiveFrame is used to move an object in the scene. Combined with object selection, its MouseGrabber properties and a dynamic update of the scene, the InteractiveFrame introduces a great reactivity in your processing applications.

Note: Once created, the InteractiveFrame is automatically added to the Scene.mouseGrabberPool().

Constructor Detail

InteractiveFrame

public InteractiveFrame(MouseGrabberPool mgPool)
Default constructor.

The GLFrame.translation() is set to (0,0,0), with an identity GLFrame.rotation() (0,0,0,1) (see Frame constructor for details). The different sensitivities are set to their default values (see rotationSensitivity() , translationSensitivity(), spinningSensitivity() and wheelSensitivity()).

Note: the InteractiveFrame is automatically added to the Scene.mouseGrabberPool().

InteractiveFrame

public InteractiveFrame(MouseGrabberPool mgPool,
                        InteractiveCameraFrame iFrame)
Ad-hoc constructor needed to make editable a Camera path defined by KeyFrameInterpolator.

Constructs a Frame from the the iFrame GLFrame.translation() and GLFrame.orientation() and immediately adds it to the Scene.mouseGrabberPool().

A call on isInCameraPath() on this Frame will return true. Attention: Internal use. You should not call this constructor in your own applications.

See Also:
Camera.addKeyFrameToPath(int)

isInCameraPath

public boolean isInCameraPath()
Returns true if the InteractiveFrame forms part of a Camera path and false otherwise.

clone

public InteractiveFrame clone()
Implementation of the clone method.

Calls GLFrame.clone() and makes a deep copy of the remaining object attributes except for prevConstraint (which is shallow copied).

grabsMouseThreshold

public int grabsMouseThreshold()
Returns the grabs mouse threshold which is used by this interactive frame to checkIfGrabsMouse(int, int, Camera).

See Also:
setGrabsMouseThreshold(int)

setGrabsMouseThreshold

public void setGrabsMouseThreshold(int threshold)
Sets the number of pixels that defined the checkIfGrabsMouse(int, int, Camera) condition.

Parameters:
threshold - number of pixels that defined the checkIfGrabsMouse(int, int, Camera) condition. Default value is 10 pixels (which is set in the constructor). Negative values are silently ignored.
See Also:
grabsMouseThreshold(), checkIfGrabsMouse(int, int, Camera)

checkIfGrabsMouse

public void checkIfGrabsMouse(int x,
                              int y,
                              Camera camera)
Implementation of the MouseGrabber main method.

The InteractiveFrame grabsMouse() when the mouse is within a grabsMouseThreshold() pixels region around its Camera.projectedCoordinatesOf(Vector3D) GLFrame.position().

Specified by:
checkIfGrabsMouse in interface MouseGrabbable

grabsMouse

public boolean grabsMouse()
Returns true when the MouseGrabber grabs the Scene's mouse events.

This flag is set with setGrabsMouse(boolean) by the checkIfGrabsMouse(int, int, Camera) method.

Specified by:
grabsMouse in interface MouseGrabbable

public void setGrabsMouse(boolean grabs)
Sets the grabsMouse() flag. Normally used by checkIfGrabsMouse(int, int, Camera).

Specified by:
setGrabsMouse in interface MouseGrabbable

grabs - flag

Defines the wheelSensitivity().

rotationSensitivity

public final float rotationSensitivity()
Returns the influence of a mouse displacement on the InteractiveFrame rotation.

Default value is 1.0. With an identical mouse displacement, a higher value will generate a larger rotation (and inversely for lower values). A 0.0 value will forbid InteractiveFrame mouse rotation (see also GLFrame.constraint()).

See Also:
setRotationSensitivity(float), translationSensitivity(), spinningSensitivity(), wheelSensitivity()

translationSensitivity

public final float translationSensitivity()
Returns the influence of a mouse displacement on the InteractiveFrame translation.

Default value is 1.0. You should not have to modify this value, since with 1.0 the InteractiveFrame precisely stays under the mouse cursor.

With an identical mouse displacement, a higher value will generate a larger translation (and inversely for lower values). A 0.0 value will forbid InteractiveFrame mouse translation (see also GLFrame.constraint()).

Note: When the InteractiveFrame is used to move a Camera (see the InteractiveCameraFrame class documentation), after zooming on a small region of your scene, the camera may translate too fast. For a camera, it is the Camera.arcballReferencePoint() that exactly matches the mouse displacement. Hence, instead of changing the translationSensitivity(), solve the problem by (temporarily) setting the Camera.arcballReferencePoint() to a point on the zoomed region).

See Also:
setTranslationSensitivity(float), rotationSensitivity(), spinningSensitivity(), wheelSensitivity()

spinningSensitivity

public final float spinningSensitivity()
Returns the minimum mouse speed required (at button release) to make the InteractiveFrame spin().

See spin(), spinningQuaternion() and startSpinning(int) for details.

Mouse speed is expressed in pixels per milliseconds. Default value is 0.3 (300 pixels per second). Use setSpinningSensitivity() to tune this value. A higher value will make spinning more difficult (a value of 100.0 forbids spinning in practice).

See Also:
setSpinningSensitivity(float), translationSensitivity(), rotationSensitivity(), wheelSensitivity()

wheelSensitivity

public float wheelSensitivity()
Returns the mouse wheel sensitivity.

Default value is 20.0. A higher value will make the wheel action more efficient (usually meaning a faster zoom). Use a negative value to invert the zoom in and out directions.

See Also:
setWheelSensitivity(float), translationSensitivity(), rotationSensitivity(), spinningSensitivity()

isSpinning

public final boolean isSpinning()
Returns true when the InteractiveFrame is spinning.

During spinning, spin() rotates the InteractiveFrame by its spinningQuaternion() at a frequency defined when the InteractiveFrame startSpinning(int).

Use startSpinning(int) and stopSpinning() to change this state. Default value is false.

spinningQuaternion

public final Quaternion spinningQuaternion()
Returns the incremental rotation that is applied by spin() to the InteractiveFrame orientation when it isSpinning().

Default value is a null rotation (identity Quaternion). Use setSpinningQuaternion(Quaternion) to change this value.

The spinningQuaternion() axis is defined in the InteractiveFrame coordinate system. You can use GLFrame.transformOfFrom(Vector3D, GLFrame) to convert this axis from an other Frame coordinate system.

setSpinningQuaternion

public final void setSpinningQuaternion(Quaternion spinningQuaternion)
Defines the spinningQuaternion(). Its axis is defined in the InteractiveFrame coordinate system.

isInInteraction

public boolean isInInteraction()
Returns true when the InteractiveFrame is being manipulated with the mouse. Can be used to change the display of the manipulated object during manipulation.

stopSpinning

public final void stopSpinning()
Stops the spinning motion started using startSpinning(int). isSpinning() will return false after this call.

startSpinning

public void startSpinning(int updateInterval)
Starts the spinning of the InteractiveFrame.

This method starts a timer that will call spin() every updateInterval milliseconds. The InteractiveFrame isSpinning() until you call stopSpinning().

spin

public void spin()
Rotates the InteractiveFrame by its spinningQuaternion(). Called by a timer when the InteractiveFrame isSpinning().

mouseClicked

public void mouseClicked(Mouse.Button button,
                         int numberOfClicks,
                         Camera camera)
Overloading of remixlab.remixcam.core.MouseGrabbable#mouseClicked(remixlab.proscene.Scene.Button, int, Camera).

Left button double click aligns the InteractiveFrame with the camera axis (see GLFrame.alignWithFrame(GLFrame) and remixlab.proscene.Scene.ClickAction#ALIGN_FRAME). Right button projects the InteractiveFrame on the camera view direction.

Specified by:
mouseClicked in interface MouseGrabbable

mousePressed

public void mousePressed(Point eventPoint,
                         Camera camera)
Initiates the InteractiveFrame mouse manipulation. Overloading of MouseGrabbable.mousePressed(Point, Camera). The mouse behavior depends on which button is pressed.

Specified by:
mousePressed in interface MouseGrabbable
See Also:
mouseDragged(Point, Camera), mouseReleased(Point, Camera)

mouseDragged

public void mouseDragged(Point eventPoint,
                         Camera camera)
Modifies the InteractiveFrame according to the mouse motion.

Actual behavior depends on mouse bindings. See the Scene documentation for details.

The camera is used to fit the mouse motion with the display parameters.

Specified by:
mouseDragged in interface MouseGrabbable
See Also:
Camera.screenWidth(), Camera.screenHeight(), Camera.fieldOfView()

mouseReleased

public void mouseReleased(Point event,
                          Camera camera)
Stops the InteractiveFrame mouse manipulation.

Overloading of MouseGrabbable.mouseReleased(Point, Camera).

If the action was ROTATE MouseAction, a continuous spinning is possible if the speed of the mouse cursor is larger than spinningSensitivity() when the button is released. Press the rotate button again to stop spinning.

Specified by:
mouseReleased in interface MouseGrabbable
See Also:
startSpinning(int), isSpinning()

mouseWheelMoved

public void mouseWheelMoved(int rotation,
                            Camera camera)
Overloading of MouseGrabbable.mouseWheelMoved(int, Camera).

Using the wheel is equivalent to a remixlab.proscene.Scene.MouseAction#ZOOM.

Specified by:
mouseWheelMoved in interface MouseGrabbable
See Also:
setWheelSensitivity(float)

startAction

public void startAction(Actions.MouseAction act,
                        boolean withConstraint)
Protected internal method used to handle mouse actions.
